description: The cause of CVE-2023-5997 originates from a use-after-free condition in the garbage collection process within Chromium, which is integrated into Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw allows for the possibility of unintended access to freed memory, potentially leading to application crashes or exploitation leading to arbitrary code execution. The issue impacts specific builds of Microsoft Edge, particularly build 119.0.2151.72, which has been updated to mitigate this vulnerability effectively. This update, documented under KB-119.0.2151.72, indicates that the latest version of Microsoft Edge is now secure against this type of flaw, emphasizing the importance of keeping applications updated to safeguard against emerging threats.
